DataElement.preferredName: Dialysis Twice Or Twenty Four Hour Continuous Venovenous Hemodialysis Therapeutic Procedure One Week Prior Serum Creatinine Measurement Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no response to indicate whether dialysis occurred twice or 24 hours of Continuous Veno-venous Hemodialysis (CVVHD) was done within a week prior to performing the serum creatinine test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dialysis Twice Or Twenty Four Hour Continuous Venovenous Hemodialysis Therapeutic Procedure One Week Prior Serum Creatinine Measurement Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of cleansing the blood when the kidneys are not able to filter the blood._Two times._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A method for hemodialysis that removes blood from a large vein (femoral, subclavian, or internal jugular), pumps it through a dialysis circuit, and returns it into the venous circulation. This method avoids fluid shifts and other complications of conventional dialysis for patients with acute renal failure._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._Any period of seven consecutive days._Earlier in time or order._A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Dialysis Twice Or Twenty Four Hour Continuous Venovenous Hemodialysis Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of cleansing the blood when the kidneys are not able to filter the blood.:Two times.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes.:A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A method for hemodialysis that removes blood from a large vein (femoral, subclavian, or internal jugular), pumps it through a dialysis circuit, and returns it into the venous circulation. This method avoids fluid shifts and other complications of conventional dialysis for patients with acute renal failure.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to remove toxic substances from the blood that is used in patients with end-stage chronic kidney disease or acute kidney failure. This includes hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A natural number greater than twenty-three and less than twenty-five and the quantity that it denotes.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

A method for hemodialysis that removes blood from a large vein (femoral, subclavian, or internal jugular), pumps it through a dialysis circuit, and returns it into the venous circulation. This method avoids fluid shifts and other complications of conventional dialysis for patients with acute renal failure.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: One Week Prior Serum Creatinine Measurement Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Earlier in time or order.:A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
